Container.Name: SWAMI
Container.Overview: SWAMI is a lightweight, super-fast, browser-based catalogue for your Movies directory. No media scraping, instant filters, and one-click updating. Perfect for browsing on Unraid without using your media front end!

br.br:
SWAMI is a Docker-ready web UI for instant, filterable browsing of your Movies folder on Unraid (or any system).
Zero scrapingâ€”catalogue is built from file/folder names only.
Safe: never writes or modifies your Movies share.
One-click update. Dark/light mode. Filter by year, quality, keyword.
Quick Start:
Set the path to your Movies folder below (do NOT put your actual Movies folder in appdata).
Leave SWAMI Config Folder as the default (/mnt/cache/docker/appdata/swami).
Adjust filter/label options if you wish (see field descriptions below).
Open WebUI after starting the container. That's it!
Documentation & Example use: See the README at https://github.com/hdagar/unraid_apps

Path.Name: SWAMI Config Folder
Path.Description: SWAMI stores its config in the /data folder inside the container (default is the SWAMI docker appdata folder). This should point to a path on your Unraid server such as /mnt/cache/docker/appdata/swami or /mnt/user/appdata/swami for persistent settings, scan files, etc.

Path.Name: HOST path to Movies folder
Path.Description:
Path on your host to your Movies folder / share.
READ ONLY permissions.

Variable.Name: MOVIE_PATH
Variable.Label: Movies path inside container (MOVIE_PATH)
Variable.Description:
Path inside the container where your Movies folder is accessible.
Default is /mnt/user/Movies. This must match the container path from your Movies folder mapping above.
Only change this if you remap your Movies folder to a different path inside the container.

Variable.Name: CATALOG_PATH
Variable.Label: SWAMI Catalogue Path (CATALOG_PATH)
Variable.Description:
Where SWAMI will store its data.
Must match container path value in "SWAMI Config Folder".

Variable.Name: FILTER_LABELS
Variable.Label: UI Filters (comma separated)
Variable.Description:
The filters you want defined. Comma-separated. CAUTION: Suggest a maximum of 6 for usability.
Example: BluRay,UHD 4K,1080p,720p

Variable.Name: REMOVE_LABELS
Variable.Label: Ignored/Filter Labels (comma separated)
Variable.Description:
Comma-separated list. Anything with these as part of the file or directory name will be filtered out from appearing in the catalogue.
Example: 01BluRay,02UHD4K,.stfolder

Variable.Name: FLASK_PORT
Variable.Label: Flask Web Server Port (FLASK_PORT)
Variable.Description:
The port SWAMI's Flask web server will listen on inside the container.
Default here is 1050 for Unraid. In the Dockerfile, the default is 5000, but this will be overridden by this template setting.
If you change this, make sure the "Container Port" in the port mapping below matches.
Unless you have a port conflict, you can leave this as 1050.
